name: Stamford Plaza Melbourne

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed for one night in the 'Hermitage Suite', described as a loft style suite. In reality, it was a poor use of a narrow section at the end of the hall with very dated bathroom, fixtures and old and dusty scalloped curtains. The cleaner must have done a 'dump' as the toilet was filthy and not flushed on our arrival. A most unacceptable state for any hotel. The bathroom itself was cramped and dated. No choice of pillows. All four were hard and high.
reviews.title: Would not stay again, does not deserve four stars

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2011
reviews.text: The foyer is dim, check-in was very slow and only one of the two elevators were working leaving crowds of people waiting to get up and down from their rooms. The bar staff at Harry's were rude and the groups of football fans spoilt the atmosphere.
reviews.title: Great hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The breakfast was reasonable and the staff were helpful. Valet parking worked well if not slow, took 30 mins to return the car.
reviews.title: comfort and convenience

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Stayed Anzac weekend. Loved the hotel. Staff friendly and helpful. Rooms clean and tidy. Nice little bar (Harrys bar) sensational buffet breakfast which was included in deal, even got a brewed coffee with breakfast with no charge. Nothing was ever a problem, we could take our unfinished champagne back to our room with ice bucket. Ordered a room service cheese plater which was again sensational.
reviews.title: The retro tape deck was a nice touch...?

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2011, traveled with family
reviews.text: We stayed at the Stamford Plaza for two nights just prior to Easter, on a visit to Melbourne to see the Bob Dylan concert.
reviews.title: A great family weekend

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed at the Stamford Plaza last year and were pleasantly surprised this time to find the suite (which was a 1 BR suite) refurbished with elegant and comfortable furnitures. The bedroom and the living room have wall-mounted flat screen TVs. Staff is very friendly and helpful. Only one of the two lifts was working and it took a while and a bit of squeezing to get to your level. There are a few things which we found not so exciting: The rooms are dark as they face the other tower. The bathroom is very small and there is little space to put things around the vanity. There is a shower over bath, and bathtub and toilet are separate from the vanity area. The closet space is right next to the vanity, very small as well and a bit annoying to access. I think a 5* hotel should supply quilt covers and not just sheets draped over a quilt and tucked under the mattress. Unless you feel comfortable sleeping like in a straight jacket you will find yourself in a bit of a mess of sheets and blanket in the morning, something I find not very hygienic. The kitchen is very practical with a nice big fridge, however, glasses and dishes for 2 people only, no cutting board or knife, etc. Although there is a dual cook top, there is no cookware at all. I doubt people will travel with their own frypan, so I guess the kitchen is not meant to do some cooking. However, all this put aside, it is a comfortable hotel and the location is fantastic!
reviews.title: Comfortable suite hotel in perfect location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2011, traveled with family
reviews.text: I wouldn't classify this hotel as 5 stars... One of the lifts was broken which meant lenghty waits, and our keys wouldn't unlock the door to our room.
reviews.title: This isn't five stars

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2011
reviews.text: We had to ask them TWICE to fix this issue. The first time we had to go all the way back down to the foyer and sort it out, and the second time we called from the phone next to the lifts and were told that someone was on their way up.
reviews.title: Not 5 star

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2011
reviews.text: We waited ten minutes and still no one arrived so we had to go back downstairs and actually ask them to come up.
reviews.title: Excellent service, central location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This kind of thing would be acceptable at some dodgy motel in the suburbs but this is apparently a 5 star hotel in the city. If it happened once then that is understandable, but to have to deal with this kind of crap a second time round and to be kept waiting is pretty much a joke.
reviews.title: Not worth the money

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: we stayed at this hotel at the tail-end of our trip to Australia and really enjoyed the hotel and its convenient location. Staying here was so convenient that we barely took the train. This hotel is in the shopping district, sort of like staying in Midtown Manhattan not far from Madison Avenue - feel. The hotel staff were really helpful and friendly. They helped us book a trip to the Twelve Apostles and worked with the price range and type of service I was looking for (small group travel). We got a suite and it was so nice, they had a tea kettle and refilled our tea bags and cookies daily. There was even a microwave but we had no need for it. Chinatown was in walking distance and we had cheap eats and good food. We definitely recommend staying here. It was a very safe area as well.
reviews.title: Loved the hotel and it was so convenient

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed in a QS bed suite, gorgeous room, seperate bedroom and little sitting room with tea/coffee facilities &microwave, which we didn't use anyway, had drinks and snacks at Harry's Bar before going to theatre, lovely bar and atmosphere, could have sat there all night... Bathroom is bit on the small side but didn't bother us. Great location, awesome buffet breakie. But did have music going all night somewhere outside, was still going 8am, not sure where from, didn't bother my husband but I am a poor sleeper anyway...wouldnt' hesitate to recommend though.
reviews.title: Excellent!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2011, traveled on business
reviews.text: Grabbed a last minute deal for this hotel.
reviews.title: Right near everything

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2011
reviews.text: It was fully renovated and had everything you needed, a kitchenette with all facilities and also a table and couch.
reviews.title: Spectacular service, stunning location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2011
reviews.text: Beside that "room" was a comfy queen bed, leading into the bathroom which had a bath (1 person).
reviews.title: Repeat offender!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Stayed for a weekend getaway. The hotel is very well located, and you can walk around the Melbourne CBD very easily from here.
reviews.title: Great location - hotel OK, but 5 star?

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2011, traveled with family
reviews.text: Had to be moved to a second room after one night owing to the early morning wake up call of garbage trucks loading up in an alleyway beside the hotel (nothing like the sound of 1000's of crashing bottles at 4.30am!).
reviews.title: Highly recommended. Pity we couldn't stay longer.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Staff were very understanding about our comments about the early morning noise, so I don't think I was the first one to raise it with them.
reviews.title: a little like faulty towers

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Nice bar, very good reception staff who pointed us in the direction of an excellent greek restaurant.
reviews.title: lovely

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Would we stay here again? Maybe, but might explore some other 5 star options first.
reviews.title: Comfortable and clean in a good location

description: Experience premium five star luxury in Melbourne's finest all-suite hotel. Located at the "Paris end" of Little Collins Street in the heart of the CBD, Stamford Plaza Melbourne is surrounded by the best of fashion, theatre, cuisine, and only walking distance to the city's famous sporting venues. An ideal location for those wanting to immerse themselves in Melbourne's vibrant culture.
